conclusion: Work done by an ideal gas in a cyclic process
To find the work done externally by the gas from state A to state B, analyze the cyclic process shown in the figure and use appropriate thermodynamic principles.
Path A→B is an isobaric process (constant pressure)
Pressure at point A (and B) is p = 1 × 10^5 Pa (1 bar)
Volume at point A corresponds to V/L = 3
Volume at point B corresponds to V/L = 4
For an isobaric process, the work done by the gas is given by W_{A→B} = p ⋅ ΔV
Determine ΔV: Change in volume = V_B - V_A = (4L) - (3L) = L
Calculate work done: W_{A→B} = p ⋅ ΔV = 1 × 10^5 Pa × L
Express work in standard units, understand what L represents. L appears to be a unit of volume in this problem, no specific value provided, keep it as a parameter.

The work done externally by the gas from state A to state B is 1 × 10^5 L joules, where L represents the unit volume reference used in the problem. Positive sign indicates work is done by the gas on the surroundings.
